Posts.Content: im so sorry to hear about your situation.  i can only imagine what it's like.  i have recently been diagnosed with breast CA.  after the initial shock and grief.. one of my main concerns was how are my loved ones taking it.  it took me a while before i got to ask them how they felt.  my mom was very positive about it.  although im not sure if she was being completely honest with me.  i think she feels the need to be strong for me.  but sometimes i worry about her.  that there are a lot of emotions that she is suppressing. my boyfriend was very supportive but just like my mom i know he is also suppressing a lot of emotions.  my father passed away from cancer and i know the feeling of being the relative of a cancer patient.  i know that you feel the need to be strong but im sure that even without you saying it, your mom and your girlfriend worries about you.   i agree that you need to have someone to talk to... this forum could be a good outlet for you.   i hope your situation gets better..  hang in there..
Posts.Title: Double Blow, mother and girlfriend

Posts.Content: hi ksfitness32..  im new here..  im currently recovering from my mastectomy and decided to look up for support groups online.   im so sorry you are having a rough time.  i know that it can be very difficult.  specially when your options are very limited.  i know that there aren't many words i can say to make you feel better.  but i hope that knowing that people are listening and that you are not alone somehow helps.   we all go thru a difficult phase and sometimes we just have to push thru.   i hope you are feeling better by now.  sending love and prayers your way...
Posts.Title: Feeling so hopeless!!!!

Posts.Content: thank you for sharing!  oh i so happy to read this!  like l-ren, i too has never had children and i would want one someday. but i do not have the resources to freeze my egg.  :(    im 34 now and i feel that my child bearing window is closing as it is.  and then there's my diagnosis.  i hope i still have a chance at it.   i haven't started chemo and im hoping i won't have to.  i just had my mastectomy and im seeing my doctor on monday.  hope everything goes well.   thanks again.  :)
Posts.Title: fertility after chemo

Posts.Content: oh i know what you are talking about.  that was terrible pain!  i just had mine about a week ago (had surgery last week).  i agree that there should be someone there to at least hold your hand.  and doctors should be a LOT more compassionate.   the anxiety is tough enough.  and being pricked by needles again and again makes it worse.   maybe you could bring in someone with you for your procedure?..  im sorry you have to do this again.  just push thru the pain.  i know it's difficult.  but we have to do whatever we have to do to beat this.  and unfortunately for us, sentinel node biopsy is one of them.    hope your procedure goes well.
